messages.content: Facerestore_cf is a custom node for ComfyUI that uses stable diffusion models to restore faces in images.
What does this node allow you to do?
This node allows users to restore faces in images, similar to the face restore option in AUTOMATIC1111 webui.
What is the difference between facerestore_cf and the original facerestore custom node?
Facerestore_cf is a copy of the original facerestore custom node with a change to support CodeFormer Fidelity parameter.
Git clone the node into the `ComfyUI/custom_nodes` folder and then run the appropriate installation file (embedded_install.bat, install.bat for windows users, install.sh for linux and mac users).
What is the role of CodeFormer in facerestore_cf?
CodeFormer provides a Fidelity parameter for face restoration in images.
What is GFPGAN and how is it used in facerestore_cf?
GFPGAN is a model used for face restoration along with CodeFormer. It is provided as a pack for the system to perform face restoration in images.
What is the purpose of face detection models in facerestore_cf?
Face detection models are used to identify and crop faces from images, which are then processed by the face restoration model.
Are the face detection models automatically downloaded when each is used for the first time?
Yes, the face detection models are automatically downloaded and placed in the models/facedetection folder when used for the first time.
What is parsing_parsenet.pth used for in facerestore_cf?
parsing_parsenet.pth is used to put the restored faces back into the original image.
